titleStmt.title: In Loving Memory of Mary Anne Harrison

availability.p: Copyright © 2018, Christopher Alan Mosher, Shelton, Connecticut, USA.
availability.licence: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

sourceDesc.bibl: In Loving Memory of Mary Anne Harrison, funeral booklet, 6 May 1953, Corning, New York, USA. All non‐blank pages and cards removed from original booklet, for archiving and digitization. Original pages are unnumbered. Includes guest list that appears to be actual signatures. Includes a record of events and family written by unknown author, possibly her daughter Alice Harrison; Harrison/McLaughlin Documents, Archive of Historical Family Documents, Christopher A. Mosher, Shelton, Connecticut, USA. Received from Barry Mosher, who received it from his mother Alice Harrison.

correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
To live
in the hearts
of those we leave behind
is not to die
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want,
He maketh me to lie down in green pastures;
He leadeth me beside the still waters,
He restoreth my soul; He leadeth me on the
paths of righteousness for His name's sake.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of
the shadow of death, I will fear no evil;
for thou are with me, thy rod and thy staff
they comfort me.
Thou preparest a table before me in the
presence of mine enemies; Thou anointest
my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
Surely goodness and mercy shall follow
me all the days of my life; and I will
dwell in the house of the Lord for ever.
with our Sympathy
Senior Class
Hamilton
with our Sympathy
Neighbors of Hamilton
With Sympathy . . .
Tuscarora Lodge
with our Sympathy
Ralph Purdy
Henry Brustad
Carl Schlimner
Not till the loom is silent
And the shuttles cease to fly,
Shall God unroll the curtain
And explain the reason why;
The dark threads are as needful,
In the Weaver's skillful hand.
As the threads of gold and silver
In the pattern He has planned.
In Loving Memory of

No one could tell where my soul might be,
I searched for God but He eluded me;
I sought you out,—and found all three.
Family Record
Full Name of Deceased Mary Anne Harrison
Born July 23, 1853 Died May 42, 1953
Mother Margaret Dougherty
Born Ireland Died Hornby, N.Y.
Father William McLaughlin
Born Ireland Died Hornby, N.Y.
Life is eternal;
and love is immortal,
And death is only a horizon,
and a horizon is nothing—
save the limit of our sight.
― R. W. Raymond

In My Father’s House
“In my Father’s House there are many rooms”
― John 14:2
No, not cold beneath the grasses,
Not close‐walled within the tomb;
Rather, in my Father’s mansion,
Living in another room.
Living, like the one who loves me,
Like my child with cheeks abloom,
Out of sight, at desk or school‐book,
Busy in another room.
Nearer than my son whom fortune
Beckons where the strange lands loom;
Just behind the hanging curtain,
Serving in another room.
Shall I doubt my Father’s mercy?
Shall I think of death as doom,
Or the stepping o’er the threshold
To a bigger, brighter room?
Shall I blame my Father’s wisdom?
Shall I sit enswathed in gloom,
When I know my loves are happy,
Waiting in the other room?
― robert freeman
Thoughtfully
Dedicated
To Those
We Serve
a. w. beilby & son
funeral service
corning, new york
